sen.j: 藤原 為光（ふじわら の ためみつ、天慶5年(942年)- 正暦3年6月16日 (旧暦)(992年7月23日)）は、平安時代中期の公家。
sen.e: Born in 942 and gone in 992, - in detail, the date he was gone is June 16 by the lunar calendar (July 23 by the solar calendar) - "FUJIWARA no Tamemitsu" was a court noble in the middle of the Heian period.

sen.e: And then Tamemitsu was apponited as "Sachuben" (Middle Controller of the Left) in 968, and after holding "Kurodo no to" (Head Chamberlain) at the enthronement of Emperor Enyu & other positions, he rose to "Sangi" (the Royal Adviser) in 970.

sen.j: 異母兄である伊尹・藤原兼通から可愛がられ、天延元年（973年）に先任参議6名を飛び越して権中納言に抜擢され、同時に従三位に除せられる。
sen.e: Favored by his elder half brother Koretada & by "FUJIWARA no Kanemichi," Tamemitsu leapfrogged to "Gon no chunagon" (Deputy Middle Councillor) in 973 over senior 6 "Sangi," and he also got the investiture of "Jusanmi" (Junior Third Rank) at the same time.

sen.e: In 975, he was given the title of "Chunagon" (Middle Councillor), and in the next year, he got the investiture of "Shosanmi" (Senior Third Rank).

sen.j: 貞元 (日本)2年（977年）には正二位大納言となり、兼通から疎んじられていた異母兄藤原兼家を超え、大納言筆頭となる。
sen.e: In 977, he rose to "Shonii" (Senior Second Rank) & "Dainagon" (Major Councillor), and then he became the top of "Daingon," overtaking his elder half brother "FUJIWARA no Kaneie" who was treated coldly by Kanemichi.

sen.j: だが、兼通の死後に兼家が右大臣に就任して再び為光を超えることとなり、兼家と将来の摂関の地位を争うこととなる。
sen.e: But after Kanemichi died, Kaneie went over Tamemitsu once again by assuming "Udaijin" (Great Minister of the Right), and in later years, Kaneie went into a struggle with Tamemitsu for the positions of Regent & Chief Adviser to the Emperor.

sen.j: 花山天皇即位後、天皇の要望を受けて娘・忯子を入内させた。
sen.e: After the enthronement of Emperor Kazan, Tamemitsu made her daughter Yoshiko enter "Dairi" (the Inner Palace) at the emperor's request.
sen.cmt: ※「入内（じゅだい）」とは、「女性が正式の儀式を経て内裏に入ること」であり（集英社・国語辞典参照）、これを踏まえて英訳しています。

sen.j: 忯子は天皇の寵愛を受け、父親である為光も内給所を任されるなど、外戚で為光の義弟・婿でもある藤原義懐と並んで重きをなした。
sen.e: Because of Yoshiko's winning the favor of the emperor, her father Tamemitsu weighed in the court in parallel with "FUJIWARA no Yoshichika" (the emperor's relative on its mother's side & Tamemitsu's younger brother-in-law & Tamemitsu's son-in-law), and the influence of Tamemitsu was shown by his appointment to "Naikyusho" (the office entrusted by the emperor in exchange for some rewards).
sen.cmt: ①「内給」とは、「平安中期以降、天皇に与えられるようになった年料給分」のこと（そして「年料給分」とは「任意の者を自分の代わりに一定の地位に付け、その者から任料・叙料を得ること」）で、「要は売位・売官の一種」（以上、kotobank.jp 「内給」参照）です。これらを踏まえ、「内給所」の解説でも「一定の対価と引き換えに天皇から任される官職」と訳しています。②「外戚」とあるのは、「為光の」ではなく「（花山）天皇の」であるので（Wiki 「藤原伊尹」の「系譜」・「妻」の「五男」及び「長女」の欄参照）、その点補っています。
sen.e: Because Yoshiko's won the favor of the emperor, her father Tamemitsu held equal weight in the court as compared to "FUJIWARA no Yoshichika" (the emperor's relative on its mother's side & Tamemitsu's younger brother-in-law & Tamemitsu's son-in-law), and Tanemitsu's influence is exemplified by his appointment to "Naikyusho" (the office entrusted by the emperor in exchange for some rewards).

sen.j: だが、忯子の急死と花山天皇の出家、続く一条天皇の即位とその外祖父・兼家の摂政就任によって、為光の野心は挫折することになる。
sen.e: However, Yoshiko's sudden death caused Emperor Kazan to become a priest, and next, Emperor Ichijo ascended the throne and Kaneie, who was the new emperor's maternal grandfather, became Regent, so Tamemitsu was frustrated with his ambition.

sen.j: だが、兼家は左大臣源雅信に対抗するために為光との連携を図り、寛和2年（986年）右大臣に任じられて、翌987年（寛和3年）には従一位に叙せられた。
sen.e: However, Kaneie tried to cooperate with Tamemitsu for counterbalancing "MINAMOTO no Masanobu" who was the then "Sadaijin" (Great Minister of the Left), so Tamemitsu was appointed to "Udaijin" in 986 and got the investiture of "Juichii" (Junior First Rank) in the next year.
